001package imagingbook.calibration.zhang.util;
002
003import ij.ImagePlus;
004import ij.gui.Plot;
005import ij.gui.PlotWindow;
006import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
007import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.Camera;
008import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
009import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
010
011import java.awt.Color;
012
013
014/**
015 * This class defines ImageJ-related utility methods used for camera calibration.
016 *
017 * @author WB
018 */
019public class IjUtil {
020
021        /**
022         * Creates a float-type image of the supplied matrix. Matrix rows/columns correspond to image rows/columns. Typical
023         * usage: makeImage("my matrix", M).show()
024         *
025         * @param title the image title
026         * @param M the matrix to be displayed
027         * @return the resulting image
028         */
029        public static ImagePlus makeImage(String title, RealMatrix M) {
030                float[][] fdata = Matrix.toFloat(M.transpose().getData());
031                ImagePlus im = new ImagePlus(title, new FloatProcessor(fdata));
032                im.show();
033                return im;
034        }
035        
036        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
037        
038        
039        public static PlotWindow plotLensDistortionFunction(Camera cam, double rmax) {
040                int n = 100;
041//              double[] K = cam.getK();
042                double[] xVals = new double[n];
043                double[] yVals = new double[n];
044                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
045                        double r = i * (rmax / n);
046                        //double d = cam.distFun2(r * r); //getRadialDistortion(r, K);
047                        double d = cam.D(r);
048                        xVals[i] = r;
049                        yVals[i] = d;
050                }
051                Plot plot = new Plot("d(r)", "x", "f(x)");
052                plot.setColor(Color.BLUE);
053                plot.setLimits(0, 1.25, -0.1, 0.1);
054                plot.addPoints(xVals, yVals, Plot.LINE);
055                plot.draw();
056                return plot.show();
057        }
058        
059        // ---------------------------------------------------------------

071}
